intro: Gilia castellanosii, commonly known as the Castellanos' gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Gilia castellanosii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
